greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime either of the form prime(n)*2^k - 1 or prime(n)*2^k + 1, k >= 0, or 0 if no such prime exists, where prime(n) denotes the n-th prime number.
comment: Primes arising from A194606 (or 0 if no such prime exists).
link: Arkadiusz Wesolowski, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: For n=4, 7*2^0-1 and 7*2^0+1 are composite, but 7*2^1-1=13 is prime, so a(4)=13.
mathematica: Table[p = Prime[n]; k = 0; While[! PrimeQ[a = p*2^k - 1] && ! PrimeQ[a = p*2^k + 1], k++]; a, {n, 100}] (* _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Sep 04 2011 *)
results.author: _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Aug 30 2011
